abstract: Potential support from California and New York for a settlement to address foreclosure abuses would come in exchange for tightening provisions to preserve the right to investigate past misdeeds by the banks and stepping up oversight, Shaila Dewan and Nelson D. Schwartz report in The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Potential support from California and New York for a settlement to address foreclosure abuses would come in exchange for tightening provisions to preserve the right to investigate past misdeeds by the banks and stepping up oversight, Shaila Dewan and Nelson D. Schwartz report in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Deal Is Closer for a U.S. Plan on Mortgage Relief
